title: Magnetic force - work removing loop from B-field

content.question: A rectangular loop made of conducting wire is at rest. The left half of the loop is within a uniform magnetic field <math alttext="vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>⇀</mo></mover></math> directed out of the page. The magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane of the rectangular loop. The right half of the loop is outside the field, as shown. A force <math alttext="vector F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>F</mi><mo>⇀</mo></mover></math> is applied to the rectangular loop such that the loop moves at a constant velocity to the right. Which of the following statements correctly relates the work done by the force <math alttext="vector F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>F</mi><mo>⇀</mo></mover></math> to remove the loop from the magnetic field and the speed of the loop?

choices.label: The amount of work required to remove the loop increases if the speed of the loop is greater.
The amount of work required to remove the loop decreases if the speed of the loop is greater.
The amount of work will be the same regardless of the speed of the loop.
Zero work is done on the loop by the <math alttext="vector F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>F</mi><mo>⇀</mo></mover></math> force regardless of the speed.

content.answer: The amount of work required to remove the loop increases if the speed of the loop is greater.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
